days.title: 1) Introduction to Python
days.description: Understand what Python is and its applications.

days.title: 2) Setting Up Your Environment
days.description: Install Python and set up a basic IDE (e.g., VSCode).

days.title: 3) Your First Python Program
days.description: Write and run your first 'Hello, World!' program.

days.title: 4) Variables and Data Types
days.description: Learn about different data types in Python.

days.title: 7) Working with Lists and Dictionaries
days.description: Use lists and dictionaries for data storage.

days.title: 8) Introduction to OOP
days.description: Learn the principles of Object-Oriented Programming.

days.title: 9) Creating Classes and Objects
days.description: Define classes and create objects in Python.

days.title: 10) Inheritance and Polymorphism
days.description: Understand key OOP concepts and use them in code.

days.title: 11) OOP Practice
days.description: Build a simple class and utilize its methods.

days.title: 12) Introduction to Web Development
days.description: Understand web development basics and frameworks.

days.title: 13) Setting Up Flask
days.description: Install Flask, a popular web framework for Python.

days.title: 14) Building Your First Web App
days.description: Create a simple web application using Flask.

days.title: 15) Working with Templates in Flask
days.description: Learn how to use templates in your web app.

days.title: 16) Handling Forms and Data
days.description: Manage user input through forms in Flask.

days.title: 17) Keeping It Secure
days.description: Implement basic security practices for your web application.

roadmap_json.overview: This learning plan will guide you through the basics of Python programming, focusing on building web applications. You'll start with the fundamentals, move into Object-Oriented Programming, and then onto web development using Flask. By the end, you'll have the skills to create simple web applications as a foundation for your career growth.

blocks.title: What is Python?
blocks.body: Python is a popular programming language known for its simplicity and readability. Itâ€™s great for beginners because you can focus on learning programming concepts rather than complicated syntax.

blocks.title: Why Use Python?
blocks.body: Python is versatile and can be used for various applications including web development, data analysis, artificial intelligence, and automation. Its large community and vast libraries make it a powerful tool.

blocks.title: Getting Started with Python
blocks.body: To start programming in Python, you need to install it on your computer. Once installed, you can write and execute Python code using an Integrated Development Environment (IDE) or text editor.

blocks.title: Python Syntax Basics
blocks.body:
Python uses indentation to define blocks of code, which makes it easy to read. For example, a simple print statement looks like this: 
```python
print('Hello, World!')
``` This will output: Hello, World!
